thread.title: 'Dance Moms' star Abby Lee Miller indicted for bankruptcy fraud
thread.title_full: 'Dance Moms' star Abby Lee Miller indicted for bankruptcy fraud | AL.com

author: Amber Sutton | asutton@al.com
title: 'Dance Moms' star Abby Lee Miller indicted for bankruptcy fraud
text:
Abby Lee Miller, star of the Lifetime's reality series "Dance Moms," has been indicted on charges of bankruptcy fraud, concealment of bankruptcy assets and false bankruptcy declarations, reports the Pittsburgh Post-Gazette.
The report says Miller is the only defendant named on the 20-count indictment, which accuses the 50-year-old dance instructor of concealing income she made from the hit series "Dance Moms" as well as various performances and merchandise sales in 2012 and 2013.
In 2010, Miller filed a petition to reorganize her dance studio, the Abby Lee Miller Dance Co. Since then, the courts say she has hid income totaling about $755,000 in various secret bank accounts. If convicted, Miller could serve five years in prison and face a fine of $250,000 for each count, according to Fox News.
